426: : Link Logistics Real Estate (“Link”) owns and operates the largest U.S.-only portfolio of logistics real estate, leasing warehouse space to everyone from e-commerce giants to mom-and-pop shops. Established by Blackstone in 2019, we combine scale, cutting-edge technology, and logistics expertise to help our customers grow their businesses. Our portfolio includes more than 500 million square feet in dynamic markets nationwide. About 6 percent of U.S. GDP—translating to some $1.4 trillion every year—flows through the space Link customers occupy in our facilities. Because we believe that good business must be synonymous with doing good, strong environmental, social and governance practices are foundational to our identity as a firm. These practices include setting ambitious goals to combat climate change, partnering with local nonprofits, and prioritizing internal diversity, equity, and inclusion efforts. We seek to use our position, ideas, and influence to drive progress in our industry and the wider world. At Link, we give our customers space to grow—and we give people space to grow, too. The Business Analyst, will partner with the AVP to help build a best-in-class operations platform that will revolutionize the Industrial Real Estate sector. Initially, your responsibilities will revolve around analyzing existing strategic initiatives and assist in formulating a business plan that: 1) assesses the viability of existing internal and external processes and 2) proposes a future roadmap and high-level implementation strategy. After establishing the Business Plan, the [Business Development]* Team will be responsible for overseeing the execution of the Business Plan and providing regular updates to Senior Management. Ultimately, the goal would be to create a replicable, reliable process and approach that could be applied to other real estate companies. This uniquely entrepreneurial role will be focused on improving Link’s operational expertise and require a deep understanding of “why” it makes decisions. RESPONSIBILITIES: Deep desire to solve complex problems Data is core to your decision-making process…but you require a deep understanding of the “story” behind the numbers before drawing conclusions Willingness to express your opinion even if it may not be the popular one Experience manipulating and sifting through large, complicated, unclean datasets Improve Link’s financial and operational reporting through enhanced data quality testing, automation of processes, and leveraging of our Snowflake-based data platform Gather, synthesize, and analyze financial and operating information through recurring and ad hoc reports Communicate results and conclusions of analyses through Excel tables, PowerPoint charts, PowerBI dashboards, and brief write-ups Prepare visualizations that effectively communicate trends, patterns, and predictions Serve as liaison with Link’s Operations, Technology, and Finance teams, partnering with them in the build-out of dashboard and analytical platforms Create presentations for Link Executive team Attend internal meetings at Link with Executive team QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelors degree required Passion for analytics and real estate Prior experience with advanced data analytics Proficient in Microsoft Excel, SQL, and Python (or R) preferred Experience with data warehouses or relational databases preferred Fluent in English Team player with strong interpersonal skills Must have the ability to multitask and prioritize workload effectively, collaborate with a broad range of colleagues, and implement efficient processes $95,000 - $105,000 represents the presently anticipated base compensation pay range for this position at Link. Actual pay may vary based on various factors, including but not limited to location and experience. This job is also eligible for a discretionary bonus.
